intro: Drimys membranea, commonly known as the velvetleaf tree, is a species native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves with a waxy texture, and its flowers are small, fragrant, and white to pale yellow in color. Drimys membranea produces round, fleshy fruits that are edible for some bird species. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
